requirements.description: Data processing of End User data can only take place if each Party complies with its obligations as stated in this Contract and as applicable under relevant privacy laws.
A privacy policy must be provided conspicuously and be adequate in accordance with applicable privacy laws.

Data collection and sharing practices can only be implemented if the privacy policy conspicuously describes the data sets collected, use cases related to personal data/information, and mentions that such data will be shared with certain third parties for applicable use cases.

Providing sufficient notice regarding rights of End Users with regard to their personal information and clearly providing for mechanisms of Opt Out elections can only be done if You comply with certain privacy laws such as CCPA, CPRA and/or other applicable US state privacy laws, if applicable to the Inventory.
The privacy policy must mention the use of third parties and use of cookies for attribution and/or serving targeted Advertisements.

type.summary: Disclosure of Third-Party Use and Cookie Usage
